description: From Latin graphicus (“belonging to painting or drawing”), from Ancient Greek γραφικός (graphikós, “belonging to painting or drawing, picturesque, of or for writing; of style, lively”), from γραφή (graphḗ, “drawing, painting, writing, a writing, description, etc.”), from γράφω (gráphō, “scratch, carve”) (cognate with English carve).

adjectives.description: graphic (comparative more graphic, superlative most graphic)

entries.meaning: Vivid, descriptive, often in relation to depictions of sex or violence.
(geology) Having a texture that resembles writing, commonly created by exsolution, devitrification and immiscibility processes in igneous rocks.
(mostly in plural) A computer-generated image as viewed on a screen forming part of a game or a film etc.
examples: I've just played this new computer game: the graphics are amazing.

entries.meaning: A moth of the subfamily Melipotini.
